data.title: Mrs Mapelli Mozzi! Princess Beatrice sweetly nods to her married name on date night with husband Edoardo
data.meta_description: Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi and Princess Beatrice stepped out in Mayfair ahead of their third wedding anniversary
data.text:
Princess Beatrice was every inch the English rose in a flirty floral dress as she joined husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi for a date night at Oswald’s on Friday. Sun-kissed and radiant, the couple appeared in particularly good spirits as they arrived at the exclusive Mayfair private members' club, where Emma Raducanu and rumoured boyfriend Carlo Agostinelli were also in attendance.

Read More

Emma Raducanu and rumoured boyfriend Carlo Agostinelli celebrate his 23rd birthday with an evening at Oswald’s

Reports of a romance have made headlines. Now Emma Raducanu and Carlo Agostinelli have stepped out at one of London’s hottest private members’ clubs

It has been reported that Bea and Edo joined tennis golden girl Emma and billionaire's son Carlo to celebrate his 23rd birthday. But it is also possible the royal couple were toasting their own special occasion: their third wedding anniversary on 17 July.

Mastering one of this summer's biggest trend – Barbiecore pink – Princess Beatrice opted for a classic fit-and-flare shirtdress silhouette from ME+EM, the royal-approved label loved by the Princess of Wales and the Duchess of Edinburgh. Adding a playful twist, Bea accessorised with poppy neon pink shoes and a woven Anya Hindmarch personalised with her initials ‘BMM’ (Beatrice Mapelli Mozzi). Edoardo, in typically dapper fashion, opted for a relaxed navy suit, open-collar white shirt and smart navy blue trainers with contrasting white soles.

Read More

Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi hails Princess Beatrice ‘the most beautiful wife in the world’ in touching wedding anniversary post

Romantic Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi declared his love for Princess Beatrice, his wife of three years, on Instagram

Property developer Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, the son of Count Alessandro Mapelli Mozzi, a former British Olympian and Italian nobleman, proposed to Princess Beatrice, the eldest daughter of Prince Andrew and Sarah, Duchess of York, in September 2019. They were long-time family friends but started dating in October 2018.

On Friday 17 July 2020, the couple married at the Royal Chapel of All Saints at Royal Lodge, Windsor, in an intimate family ceremony attended by Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh. The couple had been forced to postpone their planned May wedding due to Covid-19.

Read More

Inside Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi’s secret royal wedding

On 17 July 2020, Princess Beatrice married her fiancé in an intimate ceremony in the grounds of Windsor Castle

They have gone from strength to strength in the years since, welcoming daughter Sienna Elizabeth Mapelli Mozzi and helping to raise son Christopher ‘Wolfie’ Mapelli Mozzi, whom Edoardo shares with ex-partner Dara Huang. Princess Beatrice and Edoardo are known for their public displays of affection, like the touching Instagram post Edo shared to mark their wedding anniversary.

‘Happy wedding anniversary to the most beautiful wife in the world,’ Edo wrote, alongside a selection of photographs of his wife and their wedding day. ‘I am so grateful for every moment we have shared, every challenge we have overcome, and every dream we have pursued together. I love you more than words can say, and I can't wait to celebrate many more anniversaries with you.’

Summer of love: as Sienna Miller and Oli Green make headlines — who are the other It couples to know now?
